structure.unit: Real And Personal Property And Domestic Relations

law.catch_line: Termination Of Transitional Alimony; Modification Or Extension
law.text: [ Text of section added by 2011, 124, Sec. 3 effective March 1, 2012 applicable as provided by 2011, 124, Sec. 4. See 2011, 124, Sec. 7.] (a) Transitional alimony shall terminate upon the death of the recipient or a date certain that is not longer than 3 years from the date of the parties' divorce; provided, however, that the court may require the payor to provide reasonable security for payment of sums due to the recipient in the event of the payor's death during the alimony term. (b) No court shall modify or extend transitional alimony or replace transitional alimony with another form of alimony.
